==Prerequisites== ===Eclipse=== This plug-in was initially developed on Eclipse 3.3, then moved to later versions. Currently, the plug-in requires Eclipse 3.4 with CDT 5.0.2, but the development environment was recently moved to Mac OS X, using the '''Eclipse 3.6 Helios''', and '''JDK 1.6'''.
If you start a new project now, it is better that you go directly to 3.6 Helios, otherwise you can continue using 3.5 Galileo for a while.
There are plans for some major updates in the plug-in, but there is not yet clear what will be the minimum requirements.
===Java=== As for Java, the minimum is JDK 1.5, with '''JDK 1.6''' working just fine. The '''OpenJDK Java 6''' used in Ubuntu 10.04 is also fine.
==Plug-in installation== The following samples are from Eclipse 3.6 Helios. Previous versions might behave slightly differently, but the idea is the same.
===The recommended way=== The recommended way to install this plug-in is to use the Eclipse standard install/update mechanism:
* ''Eclipse'' menu: '''Help''' → '''Install New Software''' ** in the ''Install'' window, click the '''Add...''' button (on future updates, just select the URL) *** fill in '''Location:''' with http://gnuarmeclipse.sourceforge.net/updates *** click the '''OK''' button ** the main window will list ''There are no categorized items'' ** disable the '''Group items by category''' option ** in the main window, select the '''GNU ARM C/C++ Development Support''' ** click the '''Next''' button ** accept the unsigned plug-in
Once you define the update site URL, further updates are greatly simplified (Help -> Check For Updates).
===The alternate way=== The alternate solution to the online site is to download the archive from [http://sourceforge.net/projects/gnuarmeclipse/files/ SourceForge Files] and to point the Eclipse update mechanism to the local file:
* ''Eclipse'' menu: '''Help''' → '''Install New Software''' ** in the ''Install'' window, click the '''Add...''' button *** in the ''Add Repository'' window, click the '''Archive...''' button **** in the ''Repository archive'' window, select the downloaded .zip archive **** click the '''OK''' button *** click the '''OK''' button
This method has the disadvantage that for future updates you need to manually download each one and manually reinstall.
===Your own way=== For those who really know what they are doing, a quick and dirty way is to extract the plug-in .jar file from the downloaded archive and to copy it to the .../eclipse/plugins directory, but this is is strongly discouraged.
===Previews=== For previews, experimental releases are posted to a separate update site:
:http://gnuarmeclipse.sourceforge.net/updates-test
Sometimes you can use this site to test some features that are not completely implemented, or that might change before a final version is released.
This site is not always updated; use it carefully, back up your workspace, and do not use it for production projects.
==Rate and Review== If you successfully installed and used this plug-in, we'd be honoured to receive your '''Thumbs up''', and eventually a short review (in the main [http://sourceforge.net/projects/gnuarmeclipse Project page]).
